text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to refer to Section 2(3) of the Arbitration Act 1996 when considering whether it is appropriate for the court to act. The candidate answer refers extensively to Section 9 (stay of proceedings) and Section 44 (support of arbitration) of the AA 1996, but it never mentions or discusses Section 2(3), which deals with the scope of the court's power to grant interim relief in support of arbitration where the seat is abroad (which is highly relevant to the question of whether the injunction can stand).
